docs.abstract: A change of plea hearing has been set for Mr. Chauvin, a former Minneapolis police officer who was found guilty of murdering George Floyd in April.
docs.snippet: A change of plea hearing has been set for Mr. Chauvin, a former Minneapolis police officer who was found guilty of murdering George Floyd in April.
docs.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — A federal court on Monday set a hearing for Derek Chauvin to change his plea, signaling that the former Minneapolis police officer who was convicted of murdering George Floyd intended to plead guilty to charges that he also deprived Mr. Floyd of his civil rights.

headline.main: Derek Chauvin Appears Likely to Plead Guilty to Federal Crimes
headline.print_headline: Hearing Set to Allow Chauvin To Plead Guilty in Federal Case

docs.abstract: The police almost always win in cases before the Supreme Court. Protections against police overreach will need to come from the state and local level.
docs.snippet: The police almost always win in cases before the Supreme Court. Protections against police overreach will need to come from the state and local level.
docs.lead_paragraph: After the tragic killing of George Floyd, protests against police violence emerged in all 50 states. These conspicuous calls for change contributed to a sense that finally, the country’s leaders would take action to rein in police violence, which disproportionately affects people of color.

headline.main: To Rein In the Police, Look to the States, Not the Court

docs.abstract: Kerby Jean-Raymond has spent the last year and a half secretly trying to change the game for minority designers.
docs.snippet: Kerby Jean-Raymond has spent the last year and a half secretly trying to change the game for minority designers.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the summer of 2020, when the United States was being roiled by the aftermath of the George Floyd murder and businesses of all kinds were coming face to face with their own systemic racism, Kerby Jean-Raymond, the founder and designer of Pyer Moss, who has used his brand to shed light on Black history as well as police brutality, began to get a lot of calls.

headline.main: Meet the Next Big Fashion Group
headline.print_headline: Giving Designers Of Color Their Due

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Your Friends in New York (Fashion Collective)

docs.abstract: The Texas Board of Pardons and Paroles said it had made “procedural errors” when it issued a recommendation that Mr. Floyd be posthumously pardoned for a 2004 drug conviction.
docs.snippet: The Texas Board of Pardons and Paroles said it had made “procedural errors” when it issued a recommendation that Mr. Floyd be posthumously pardoned for a 2004 drug conviction.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Texas Board of Pardons and Paroles has withdrawn a recommendation that George Floyd be granted a posthumous pardon for a 2004 drug conviction in Houston, citing “procedural errors” in the recommendation.

headline.main: Texas Board Withdraws Clemency Recommendation for George Floyd
headline.print_headline: Clemency Recommendation for Floyd Is Withdrawn

byline.original: By Michael Levenson and J. David Goodman

docs.abstract: The first-in-the-nation effort is tackling fraught questions about who deserves payment and how much.
docs.snippet: The first-in-the-nation effort is tackling fraught questions about who deserves payment and how much.
docs.lead_paragraph: After the killing of George Floyd in Minneapolis, as the nation grappled with how to right a long history of wrongs, California took a momentous step in the name of racial equity.

headline.main: California’s Reparations Task Force Meets Again

docs.abstract: With nearly $4 million in funding, the school wants to build a pipeline of diverse fashion talent from middle school to the C-suite.
docs.snippet: With nearly $4 million in funding, the school wants to build a pipeline of diverse fashion talent from middle school to the C-suite.
docs.lead_paragraph: Change takes time: That was the sentiment underlying many corporate responses in the wake of George Floyd’s murder in 2020, as the fashion industry, among others, faced new calls for systemic change.

headline.main: The Fashion Institute of Technology Will Open a Social Justice Center
headline.print_headline: Social Justice Center For Fashion to Open

docs.abstract: A federal prosecutor said he would ask a judge to sentence Mr. Chauvin, a former Minneapolis police officer, to 25 years in prison, extending his state prison term by two and a half years.
docs.snippet: A federal prosecutor said he would ask a judge to sentence Mr. Chauvin, a former Minneapolis police officer, to 25 years in prison, extending his state prison term by two and a half years.
docs.lead_paragraph: ST. PAUL, Minn. — Derek Chauvin pleaded guilty on Wednesday to a federal charge that he used his position as a Minneapolis police officer to violate George Floyd’s constitutional rights, a move expected to extend Mr. Chauvin’s time in prison beyond a decades-long state sentence for murdering Mr. Floyd.

headline.main: Derek Chauvin Pleads Guilty to Violating George Floyd’s Rights
headline.print_headline: Ex-Officer Who Killed Floyd Admits Violating His Rights

docs.abstract: At the Catholic University of America in Washington, conservative students called for a campus ban on further displays of an artwork that depicts Floyd as Jesus.
docs.snippet: At the Catholic University of America in Washington, conservative students called for a campus ban on further displays of an artwork that depicts Floyd as Jesus.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the summer of 2020, shortly after the murder of George Floyd, Kelly Latimore, a white artist who grew up surrounded by images of a white Jesus, decided to make a course correction. He’d paint the Virgin Mary and Jesus with gold halos encircling their heads — and both would be Black.

headline.main: A Painting of George Floyd Roils Catholic University
headline.print_headline: Controversy Over Artwork Stirs Debate at Catholic University

docs.abstract: After almost a decade at the NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund, Ifill explains why advocacy is an essential part of her legal work.
docs.snippet: After almost a decade at the NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund, Ifill explains why advocacy is an essential part of her legal work.
docs.lead_paragraph: Last month, Kyle Rittenhouse was acquitted on all charges related to the shooting of two people at a Black Lives Matter protest in Kenosha, Wisc. Before, during and after the trial, journalists and pundits broke down the most sensational moments on the stand, and many tried to discern what Rittenhouse’s not-guilty decision meant about the country at large. People were eager to draw direct connections between the arguments used in court and the inequities that are seen in the country on a daily basis.

headline.main: Sherrilyn Ifill: ‘There Is No Guarantee We Make It Out of This Period as a Democracy’

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: NAACP Legal Defense and Education Fund

docs.abstract: Half a dozen defendants in the assault on the Capitol are using video to try to make a case that they were simply protecting themselves and others. They face skepticism and an uphill legal battle.
docs.snippet: Half a dozen defendants in the assault on the Capitol are using video to try to make a case that they were simply protecting themselves and others. They face skepticism and an uphill legal battle.
docs.lead_paragraph: Follow our live updates on the Jan. 6 Capitol Attack Anniversary.

headline.main: Some Jan. 6 Rioters May Use Police Brutality as a Defense
headline.print_headline: Rioters May Argue Self-Defense Against Police
